september  

Students danced Latin dances such as the Cumbia Salsa Merengue and Reggaeton on Thursday at Zumba Fitness PERIOD



Zumba Fitness displayed these varieties of dances as part of Latino Heritage Month PERIOD

Juanita Cross the chairwoman of the Latino Heritage Month committee said she was excited about having Zumba as part of the Latino Heritage Month activities PERIOD

The Zumba class was in the basement of the Newman Catholic Center and was instructed by T.M PERIOD Linda Scholz assistant professor of communication studies PERIOD

Since the Zumba class was part of Latino Heritage Month Scholz said she hoped to have many students come to the class and get educated on Zumba Fitness PERIOD

Scholz said she wanted students to know Zumba is heavily influenced by Latin music PERIOD

Zumba Fitness is very popular around the nation and a lot of people are doing it but are not aware of the Latin American influence Scholz said PERIOD

Scholz said she is of Latin American descent and because of that has a deeper connection with Zumba and the music used during the workouts PERIOD

Scholz said she started taking Zumba classes in Colorado before she moved to Charleston a little more than three years ago PERIOD

I do Zumba as a hobby for fun because I love fitness Scholz said PERIOD

Scholz said she was about to get a job in Colorado when Eastern offered her a job at the university in communication studies PERIOD

Scholz said she was just going to take Zumba classes instead of teaching them but that soon changed PERIOD

Some of Scholzs former instructors from Colorado suggested she get her license to teach a Zumba class and that is exactly what she did PERIOD

Scholz has been certified for two and a half years PERIOD

Along with Scholz there was only one other instructor in the area at the time she arrived to Charleston PERIOD Scholz said she started teaching Zumba at the local YMCA PERIOD

I wanted a good workout and I wanted to get to know the women in the community Scholz said PERIOD

Scholz said in order to keep the class in Charleston she approached Dr PERIOD Brandon Combs board certified chiropractic physician at Park Hills Spa and Wellness Center about an open space for a Zumba class PERIOD Scholz talked to Combs and said he was excited about having the class at the spa PERIOD

Scholz now primarily teaches at the spa but also teaches some classes like the one she taught on Thursday PERIOD

Abby Petrosky a senior elementary education major attended the class Thursday and said she enjoyed doing something different and

learning a new kind of dance PERIOD

Two more Zumba Fitness classes will be offered as part of Latino Heritage Month on Oct PERIOD  and Oct PERIOD  PERIOD
